headline: Barb's Broccoli-Cauliflower Salad
description: This broccoli-cauliflower salad has a delicious flavor thanks to the addition of bacon bits, sunflower seeds, red onion, and a creamy dressing.

video.description: A healthy salad with bacon bits, sunflower seeds, and a sweet and sour dressing.
video.name: Barb's Broccoli-Cauliflower Salad

name: Barb's Broccoli-Cauliflower Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels; crumble.
Combine bacon, cauliflower, broccoli, sunflower seeds, and onion in a large bowl.
Whisk salad dressing, sugar, and vinegar together until blended. Pour over cauliflower mixture and toss to coat. Refrigerate and allow to chill before serving.

review.reviewBody: Awesome! Just what I needed to use up a bag of broccoli and cauliflower! I didn't have any sunflower seeds or pecans but it was still great! I used Ken's creamy Italian
I make mine with Hidden valley ranch instead of Mayo, is a friend and family favorite! People always ask why it tastes so good
Made per recipe without changes. I enjoyed the combination of cauliflower and broccoli in this traditionally all broccoli salad. Have made it since and added raisins to it, very good. Thank you.

Wonderful Salad! Our family is eating vegetarian (ovo/lacto); so we left out the bacon and subbed in raisins for the texture and extra touch of sweetness. No one missed the bacon and we’re looking forward to leftovers for dinner tonight! Thank you!
Loved it . I did however made one change. I substituted the pecans or sunflower seeds for cashews.
I used red onion, turkey bacon, and pecans it was great. I will definitely make it again.

Oh mi GAWD!

I mean, I'm sure I've had this in my life. It tastes so familiar. 

But tonight I did an ingredient search for bacon and cauliflower and came upon this and love how I don't have to cook the broc or cauli, so the recipe keeps whatever nutrients. 

I used rice vinegar bc it was all I had. This is bomb and I will make it all the time now.
Loved it!
Easy to make. Used miracle whip life for creamy dressing. Our pecans instead of sunflower seeds added raisins.
Very tasty! This is a great salad! I needed a little extra dressing, though.
Loved it. Used grapes instead of raisins and pecans instead of almonds. The best ever!!!

exactly what I make except I haven't tried it with sunflower seeds (might have to try that). The dressing I make is ½ cup mayo,
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar,
1 teaspoon sugar & put the cheese in as you serve it so if you have left-overs the cheese doesn't get slimy.
Love this salad. The only thing I did different was used Bacon bits and add golden raisins.
Delicious! Other similar recipes add shredded cheese and I had a block of blue cheese marble that I shredded and added about 3/4 cup. Nice complement to the bacon.
Fabulous!
Delicious just the way it is
Always a favorite!! Love seeing everyones variations!! Cooking creative. Art!! Cook on!!

I switched the sugar with stevia but it was a little too sweet, so next time I'll cut that amount in half. 

I roasted some slivered almonds and used those instead of sunflower nuts. Same effect as sunflower nuts, just as good.
I LOVE THIS RECIPE!!!
II u uto yjywas it iTunes ya Ii
I used a bit more sugar and a creamy Italian dressing!
It turned out really good and everyone loved it. I changed a few things though.added some raisins and carrots .and for the sauce I used mayonnaise with balsamic vinegar,salt ,pepper and dried dill.
Love it! I even eat it raw. Sometimes with Italian or balsamic vinaigrette!

This was delicious. It makes a very large quantity, which was great, because everyone loved it and I had no leftovers. As suggested in a few comments, I made it the night before, reserving the seeds and bacon until just before serving. I will be making it often.

DELICIOUS. To make this Keto friendly for our HFLC (high fat low carb) eating habits, we omitted the sugar in the dressing...didn't miss it a bit! 
Awesome textures with the crunchy veggies and bacon and then the egg and cheese round out the dish perfectly! Could take as a meal on its own for lunch.
Adding this to our salad repertoire :)
This has become a staple for me. Thanks.
Huge favorite at potlucks!!!

5 stars for this recipe. We served it to 40 people today in our Sr Ctr cafeteria and got raves all round. It's really easy. I didn't use sunflower seeds, we used slivered almonds instead and dried cranberries. Used purchased cooked, chopped bacon, and the salad dressing is so easy - basically using what's in the fridge. I liked it so much I'm making it for a potluck next weekend. Thanks, Tom, for posting Barb's Broccoli and Cauliflower Salad
Delicious! Did a simple yogurt dressing instead of the recipe’s dressing. Received raves!!

First, I THOUGHT I had bacon, but I didn't. So, there's that. Second, I had HUGE red onion and half of that was way more than necessary, so I eyeballed what I mixed in with the broccoli and cauliflower. This was just fabulous. I plan on snacking on it all week and serving it to my husband with his marinated chicken thigh dinner tomorrow night (and take-to-work-lunch tomorrow). I will try it with the bacon another time, as it would lend a different texture and level of flavor. But, in my opinion, as a vegetarian dish, it needs nothing.

This salad was so delicious!! I made it for a party and everyone loved it! As others suggested I used poppy seed dressing for the "creamy dressing" and pecans instead of sunflower seeds as the recipe suggested. I will definitely make this again!
I added cheese. Served this at Fibers of Love lunch, it was a hit.

Excellent! Except that I used store bought bacon bits which I won't do again, this was a spectacular side salad for grilled pork chops. Or chicken. Will be repeating this one several times over the summer.

Made it as written the first time. Excellent.
Made it the second time using a broccoli slaw mixture in a bag. Excellent.
Made it the third time using the a kale slaw mixture in a bag, added dried cranberries and pumpkin seeds. Amazing.
This is a great recipe. The only thing I chose to differently was to use apple cider vinegar instead of white vinegar because we love apple cider vinegar and I added some dried cranberries!
This held up for a few days very well

I was a little hesitant to try this recipe since it was last minute and for a party, but it turned out amazing and I had several compliments on how delicious it was! I am an amateur cook and have never made anything like this. It was so easy to make, and didn't take very long at all. I wasn't sure what kind of creamy dressing, so I used poppy-seed dressing like someone else said they did. I also used pecans instead of sunflower seeds. The result was amazing and I absolutely loved it! I will definitely make this again!

My boyfriend absolutely loved it..in fact he had me make it twice in one week!!! 

I did add a little more of the dressing mix than it called for because I think I had some really large heads of broccoli and cauliflower.. (and added some diced cheddar) but yuuuuuuuumy!

I liked this recipe. It is the start of a good recipe. I think other items can be added to it but I generally like the dressing. I used golden raisins and candy coated pecan pieces. I also made a little more dressing than called for. I have used Craisins in the past, also dried cherries. Just about anything works. Cheese is good too and I have even had grapes in this salad.
I add shredded cheddar cheese to mine. This is a fantastic recipe. Thank you for sharing it!
Made it twice, with the pecans the first time, and with sesame seeds the next. We liked it with the sesame seeds much better.
Very good! Everyone at are outdoor party enjoyed this salad.

This was very good, but I did have to make a batch and a half of dressing to coat everything nicely. I added a few raisins, 1 1/2c of sharp shredded cheddar, and 6 hard boiled eggs to mine as well. I didn't have white wine vinegar, so I just used cider vinegar instead. Everybody loved it. It's even better the next day.

I added red oinion this time and my personal preference is without. The onion is very overbearing and takes away the flavor of the dressing and veggies. I think the bacon bits are what is key in this dish!
Didn't add the bacon and used Truvia instead of sugar. Was also out of seeds but it was still a hit!
Just like my mom makes, but I could never locate the recipe . Love this stuff!
I used cashews and craisins, I also did use onions, I also used fat free miracle whip, I love this salad I have gotten several requests to make this dish. I love it I also used turkey bacon
Even my wife who won't eat broccoli will eat this salad!

I found purple and yellow cauliflower at the farmers market so I used 8 oz. each of purple, yellow, and white cauliflower and 8 oz. broccoli. I didn't have any bacon though, next time I will use it. Colorful and delicious!

For my creamy dressing I used Kraft lowfat creamy ceasar. For those that said this was to much dressing for the dish need to keep in mind the size head of your broccoli and Cauliflower. If they seem smaller than the rest of the pile at the store ..make a little less of the dressing...if they seem larger than the average in the pile...make a little more. Just use common sense and modify if necessary. I used less vinegar than the recipe calls for because i know my creamy dressing had plenty in it already and didn't want it to be to over powering. So I used about 3/4T. I used maybe 4 pieces of Turkey Bacon (baked till crispy in the oven prior). My husband loved it!
This is a salad I have made for years, before finding the recipe on this site. I always use mayonnaise instead of salad dressing, and have received rave reviews, with requests for the recipe!
Delicious and fresh! I have used both Miracle Whip and Hellmans to make this salad. I prefer Hellmans. This is always a hit at summer cookouts.

delicious. dressing amount is perfect if following the recipe correctly, I cut the veggies into bite size pieces as opposed to bigger pieces or putting them them through the ninja. I bet it makes a difference in how it incorporates with the dressing. I made sure to add equal amounts of broccoli and cauliflower. probably around 4 cups of each, give or take a little. used white instead of red onion, added a handful of Sargento shredded cheddar and went with it. awesome stuff and I think I'm going to throw in a small handful of dried cranberries or raisins.
I make this salad which is delicious; with sour cream, mayo, and vinegar for the creamy dressing. It is a crowd pleaser.
Loved it, easy to make, great variety for BBQ sides. Used 1/2 cup craisins instead of sugar.

This was delishhhhh! I didnt have wine vinegar so used regular white. Tasted just fine. I have made a very similar recipe that also has rasins.
Yum yum yum!
this is the BEST salad I have ever had! I crave this! The slightly sweet dressing is wonderful and the crunch of the broccoli and cauliflower is divine! Try this one!
Had this at my local Amish market and loved it, but crazy expensive. Looked on here for one I could make cheaper myself. This is EXACTLY the same, delicious and way cheaper, love it

Love this recipe. My sister in CA has a variation that I love too. Instead of bacon she adds 1 cup of raisins, sliced scallions instead of onions. Her dressing is 3/4 c mayonnaise, 1/3 c apple cider vinegar, 1 T sugar, 1/2 tsp each salt and pepper. Whisk and mix with salad. Trust me on the raisins!
I really liked it. Hubby wouldn't even try it because the veggies weren't cooked. His loss...
Great recipe but since I am not a great fan of sweet dressings, I omitted the sugar completely and used a greek yogurt dressing instead...also toasted the sunflower seeds.
this recipe is amazing! i did substitute the sugar for spenda and i loved it! couldn't stop eating it as soon as i had it made:)
It was wonderful! Added some cheese but perfect other than that.
So good! I used a few packages of stevia in place of sugar and used regular mayo in place of salad dressing. Will be making this one again for sure.

Love this recipe. The only way there could've been too much dressing is if your head of broccoli and cauliflower were too small. I had to use 1 1/4 head of cauliflower. I used pecans but if you think anyone may have a nut allergy, you should use sunflower seeds.

author.name: A pet Walker is in heaven.

review.reviewBody: This is such a great recipe to take to the picnic, potluck etc. the key for our family is take your time to cut broccoli and culiflower to the bite sizes. Looks better and easier to eat. You can certainly add golden raisins to this recipe. It's yummy!!!
I only used half the dressing but otherwise it was great. I will add craisins next time to add some sweetness
A perfect July 4 salad for the cookout! I subbed regular white vinegar merely as a personal preference.

Similar to a salad my Gamgam used to make. This salad is delicious. The second time around I mixed it up a bit, I used non fat Greek yogurt as the 'creamy dressing'. I didn't have cheese (whoops) so I threw in a handful of dried cranberries!!! I am not gonna lie, my 2 and 10 year old love it every time
Easy and delicious. I made this on Mother's Day and everyone loved it, even the kids & our dog. I used Miracle Whip for the creamy salad dressing, but I think I will try a creamy ranch next time.
Very very good! Thanks for a great recipe.

I always use this recipe. It's a great summer salad. I recently made it for our branding and everyone loved it! This time I added a little bit of horseradish to the dressing and chopped up some green onion and red pepper that were just hanging out in my fridge. I used balsamic vinegar as I didn't have any white on hand. The color is different but the flavor was great! Usually I don't change a thing with this recipe. It's tasty the way it is.
Way too much dressing. The vegetables were drowned in it.

Excellent salad! I omitted the sunflower seed because I did not have them on hand. I took another reviewers suggestion and sprinkled in curry powder for some amazing flavor kick! I also put in a dash of garlic salt and black pepper to counter the sweet dressing. Will definitely make this again!

I used 3 C each of broccoli and cauliflower, only 1/2 C seeds and then used 1/2 Mayo w/Olive Oil and 2 packs of Splenda mixed with 1 T balsamic vinegar. For the bacon I used 4 T real bacon bits. It was an awesome recipe....Thanks!
I have been making a version of this salad for several years. Always a crowd pleaser!

I could not stop eating this dish, I loved it so much! This is a great base recipe because you can tailor it to your tastes and it will come out wonderful every time! 

I didn't have all the exact ingredients, so I made some substitutions and I also added some ingredients. I made a cole-slaw dressing instead (light mayo, milk, sugar, red wine vinegar); I only had dried, chopped onions and onion powder; the bacon I had was "maple" flavored which added a great richness and sweetness to the flavor; I added honey-roasted almond slices and plumped raisins (just soak them in super hot tap water for 3-5 mins); also, I only had the frozen broccoli and cauliflower, so I steamed them first to get them soft, then chilled the whole dish. Lastly, we were curious about how the dish would taste warm so we heated up the last couple bites and it was even better! I'm making it hot next time, I can't wait!

My wife always makess this salad when there will be ladies attending. They says it fills you up not out. She omits the sugar & vinegar. Makes her dressing of Miricle Whip Light & milk. Or uses a ranch style dressing. She will make it the night before sometimes. Great as a leftover. She serves at Christmas adding red pepper to round out the holiday colors.
From the first time I made this, I have constantly had requests for the recipe or to make it again at other functions. I didn't change a thing about the recipe except add raisins.
Excellent salad! Followed recipe exactly and did not change any ingredients. It is a keeper for us! Would make a beautiful salad for Christmas.

Husband kept saying how much he loved this recipe. The 5 stars is based on how the recipe is written, but I now make it with about 1/8 cup of honey instead of sugar and a creamy cucumber vinaigrette dressing to cut the sugar and some of the fat. Nobody notices the difference.

This is so good and is easy in that it tastes even better if made a day ahead. I used very large heads of cauliflower and broccoli, and substituted craisins for the seeds. Made 50% more of the mayo dressing, so it was nice and creamy, and left everything else the same. Don't leave out the bacon; it makes the salad. I brought it to a party and had two of the 6 women give me their email addresses so they could get the recipe. It was the only dish brought to the gathering that was completely devoured. Highly recommend.
A really good low calorie option especially if you use Greek yogurt and low fat sour cream. My taste requires a little more flavor though. Great recipe overall though!

I made this exact only leaving out the sugar and adding some fresh ground pepper. Next time, I think I'd use half mayo/half sour cream and add in some fresh minced garlic. Other than that, it was good.
My son doesn't like mayo so I used light cesar dressing with 1/2 the sugar and I only had red wine vinegar. It was still good and the family ate it up!!
Favorite by all in our house! I make it all the time! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.
I thought it was super good, and so did my guests. My 4-year old daughter likes her veggies unadorned, and wasn't a fan. I made it just as written.
Added Craisins - very good!
This is a family favorite. The only change I make is to add our favorite blend of shredded cheese - about 1 cup or so. It is sooo good!

I left the onion out and added celery, walnut, pecan, apple and carrot all chopped. My church family and my family loved this dish. You cn eat it as a meal or as a side salad. Awesome.....We Call it Church Salad

This made a lot of salad. I used one head of cauliflower and a head of broccoli, like the recipe, but it made a lot more than I expected. I needed to chop them up more than I did. I also had to make a half a cup more of salad dressing. I used ranch to make the dressing. So, all in all, it tasted delicious, but be ready for a lot of salad and chop it up smaller and make more dressing. But, its good stuff!

Fantastic recipe...easy and had all the ingredients on hand. What a wonderful way to serve veggies, even the kids had seconds of this one! This will be a real keeper especially for 'pot luck' parties. I did use bacon bits rather than real bacon and it worked out just fine - sunflower seeds gave it a 'nutty' flavor that impressed everyone. Thanks for sharing.
This is delicious! I always add raisins and craisins too, and even use pecans instead of sunflower seeds. It is one of our favorites!
DELISH!!!!
Great flavor and a good way to get your veggies! I used Low Fat Miracle Whip and it turned out well. Thanks for the tasty recipe!
I have been making this salad for years, yum, yum, YUMMY. Since I don't eat bacon, I substitute in Turkey Bacon!
Good. I used Trader Joe's Poppy Seed dressing - sparingly. And also added some feta cheese.
This was great! I used Caesar dressing and mayo and it was the perfect savory sweet combination.

Tried and true, sure to please! I recommend adding 1/2 cup craisens (great sweetness) and for the "creamy salad dressing" my favorite mix is 1/2 cup Hellman's Mayo & 1/2 cup Miracle Whip. MAJOR crowd pleaser!
